name: Moralis Web3 API
description: Integrates with Moralis Web3 API to enable blockchain data access, token analysis, and smart contract interactions...

metadata.readme_excerpt:
Moralis MCP Server

A TypeScript-based MCP server that implements a wrapper to the Moralis rest API.


![smithery badge](https://smithery.ai/badge/@MoralisWeb3/moralis-mcp-server) ## ğŸ§  Overview The **Moralis MCP Server** is a local or cloud-deployable engine that connects natural language prompts to real blockchain insights â€” allowing AI models to query wallet activity, token metrics, dapp usage, and more without custom code or SQL. Built on top of the [Model Context Protocol](https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/spec), this server makes it easy for LLMs to talk to Moralis APIs in a consistent, explainable, and extensible way. - ğŸ”— Fully pluggable: swap LLMs, customize retrieval logic, or extend with your own tools - ğŸ§± Works with OpenAI, Claude, and open-source models - ğŸ§  Powers agents, devtools, bots, dashboards, and beyond ## âš™ï¸ Common Use Cases - ğŸ¤– AI agents & assistants: â€œWhatâ€™s this walletâ€™s trading history?â€ - ğŸ“ˆ Devtools: on-chain QA, testing, CLI integrations - ğŸ“Š Dashboards: natural language to charts/data - ğŸ“‰ Monitoring: alerting & summarization for tokens/dapps - ğŸ§  Trading bots: LLM-driven strategies with real blockchain grounding ## ğŸ”
